qas.question: Prior to 1883 there is evidence that serious caucus fights occured in what years?
What prominent ex-speaker was nominated for minority role in 1875?
What former appropriations chairman was nominated for minority leader in 1876,77,79?
In what year do Democrats contend that the Speaker position began?
What were the Republicans fighting for in 1877 and 1879?

plausible_answers.text: the "nomination carried with it some vestige of leadership."

qas.question: What did the Republican fight for minority speakership indicate?
During what three years was Keifer nominated by Democrats?
What did Democrats nominate James A. Garfield for in 1875?

context: Another scholar contends that the minority leader position emerged even <b3_0>before 1883<b3_0/>. On the Democratic side, "there were serious caucus fights for <b4_0>the minority speakership nomination<b4_0/> in <a0_0>1871 and 1873<a0_0/>," indicating that <b5_0>the "nomination carried with it some vestige of leadership."<b5_0/> Further, when Republicans were in the minority, the party nominated for <b7_0>Speaker<b7_0/> a series of prominent lawmakers, including ex-Speaker <a1_0>James Blaine<a1_0/> of Maine in 1875, former Appropriations Chairman <a2_0>James A. Garfield<a2_0/> of Ohio, in <b6_0>1876, 1877, and 1879<b6_0/>, and ex-Speaker Keifer in 1883. "It is hard to believe that House partisans would place a man in the speakership when in the majority, and nominate him for this office when in the minority, and not look to him for legislative guidance." This was not the case, according to some observers, with respect to ex-Speaker Keifer.
